Description: Squat vase of limestone with a flat base and a contracted mouth. It is possible that the vase was never intended to have a separate rim, as the edges of the mouth are rounded. Interior well hollowed.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: G. Brunton, 'British Museum expedition to Middle Egypt, 1929-1931 Matmar' (London, 1948), 25 and pl. XXIII, 17; W. M. F. Petrie, 'Funeral Furniture with Stone and Metal Vases' (London, 1937), pl. XXVI, 500.
